intro: Ageratina humochica, commonly known as the blackstem ageratum, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale blue flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, giving the plant a slightly fuzzy appearance. Ageratina humochica is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
